passages.name: Help
passages.content:
[img]

Colored Names: Names of characters that are colored (such as Felix and Chloe) indicate that the character has a main storyline/relationship for you to play through. There are other characters that may ask tasks of you, but they are generally shorter and lack complexity, as opposed to the main characters which feature longer, branching stories.

Story Icon[img]: This icon indicates an important option that starts or progresses a storyline.

Stat Icons[img][img][img][img]: These icons are meant to easily notify you of the main stat that an action will affect (or require). Note that it doesn't tell you ALL stats affected or to what degree, so make sure you pay attention!

Energy: Pretty self explanatory, but you need energy to perform most actions. Don't forget to sleep, as this is your main way of recovering energy and moving forward in the week!

Arousal: A simple indicator of how aroused your character is; it ranges from 0 to 100. Be sure to keep track of it, as having too high or too low arousal will affect certain events.

Allure: Also ranging from 0 to 100, this is a measure of how appealing you are to other characters in general. This can affect some events, as well as even changing how some people act around you. In particular, it can affect how much you are paid when working a job!

Drunk and High: These meters measure how drunk or high you are respectively. Getting too drunk all the time can cause you to get sick and even addicted, whereas getting too high has a similar effect but can even go so far as to put you in the hospital if you aren't careful.

Femininity: The femininity meter is found on the Status page and shows how feminine your character has become. This will affect events in various ways, ranging from simple dialogue changes to changing what actually happens during the event or even the outcome. While it ranges from -100 to 100, most events look at it in segments of 25 (25 > 50 > 75 > 100) The baseline value is 0 and anything above that is
